meanings.definition: A member of a group of people who lived in England during the Anglo-Saxon period.
meanings.sent1: The theow helped the villagers with their daily tasks.
meanings.sent2: The theow was a loyal member of the Anglo-Saxon community.
meanings.sent3: The theow accidentally spilled the milk while trying to help.
meanings.sent4: The theow's presence in the village was like a thread weaving through the fabric of society.
meanings.sent5: The theow's role was crucial in the functioning of the community.

meanings.definition: To serve or work for someone as a slave or servant.
meanings.sent1: She would theow for the noble family every day.
meanings.sent2: He theowed for his master with dedication and loyalty.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to theow for the family, always following them around.
meanings.sent4: The sun theowed its warmth upon the earth, nurturing all life.
meanings.sent5: The river theowed through the valley, carrying stories of the land.
